intro: Impatiens leveillei, commonly known as the Madagascar impatiens, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Impatiens leveillei thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
